channel.title: Taking the server source and making it an actual server
channel.description:
how do i do this? i do not want hamachi, and the reason i am asking instead of looking at melissa T's sticky is because i did check it, and it is outdated. the current version of moparscape does not have a "moparscape.zip" file. any help is very much appreciated. the server source i have is adventurescapesource, although i do not know if this matters.
edit at(12:13pm eastern US time):OH COME ON! NO ONE KNOWS?!?!? i find that hard to believe. edit at(2:30pm eastern US time): im seriously startin to get PO'd that no one cares enough to help........ THERES 12 VIEWS BUT NO REPLIES!!! WTF

item.title: Taking the server source and making it an actual server
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

well, uh… no. but O M G said that that default gateway thing is the router(he thinks)
EDIT: my dad says that my comp has no router but that our firewall serves as a router, and since the comp is plugged into a network hub that the firewall is also plugged in, i might as well have a router.

Read full topic

item.title: Taking the server source and making it an actual server
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

it says in his tut that i must type the IP of the router into the internet browser. where would i type it in? i have already tried the address bar and that just gives me an error saying the internet browser couldn’t find it.

Read full topic

item.source: Taking the server source and making it an actual server

item.title: Taking the server source and making it an actual server
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

IP Address. . . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.16 Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : 255.255.255.0 Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.1
obviously the first one is my computer's IP but which would be the router?

Read full topic
item.source: Taking the server source and making it an actual server

item.title: Taking the server source and making it an actual server
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Open the Windows Command Prompt (Start > All Programs > Accessories > Windows Command Prompt) (or Start > Run > cmd) and type ipconfig and it should give you three IP’s. I believe it labels them but if not post back.

Read full topic
item.source: Taking the server source and making it an actual server

item.description:

thanks a lot O M G. finally some one helped one last thing i need help with. some of the assumed knowledge in the tut is routers. how can i find the IP adress of my router and my computer?(i realize these are probably different)

Read full topic
